Jump to: navigation, search

Harcourt.jpg](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/04/Gates_of_Oil_reifnery_in_Port_Harcourt.jpg/220px-
Gates_of_Oil_reifnery_in_Port_Harcourt.jpg)](/wiki/File:Gates_of_Oil_reifnery_in_Port_Harcourt.jpg)
The Port Harcourt Refining Company Ltd.

[Type](/wiki/List_of_business_entities "List of business entities") | [State-owned](/wiki/State-owned_enterprise "State-owned enterprise")

Founded | 1965 (1965)  
Headquarters | [Port Harcourt](/wiki/Port_Harcourt "Port Harcourt"), Nigeria  
Area served | Nigeria  
Key people | Mr Shehu Malami (Managing Director),[1] Mr Ganiyu Owolabi (Executive Director Operations)[2]  
Products | Petroleum and derived products  
Owner | [Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation](/wiki/Nigerian_National_Petroleum_Corporation "Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation")  
Website | [www.nnpcgroup.com/nnpcbusiness/subsidiaries/phrc.aspx](http://www.nnpcgroup.com/nnpcbusiness/subsidiaries/phrc.aspx)  
  
The **Port Harcourt Refining Company** , ([abbreviated](/wiki/Abbreviation
"Abbreviation") **PHRC**), is a [Port Harcourt](/wiki/Port_Harcourt "Port
Harcourt")-based [oil](/wiki/Oil "Oil") and [gas](/wiki/Gas "Gas") company
primarily specializing in the refining of [crude oil](/wiki/Crude_oil "Crude
oil") into [petroleum products](/wiki/Petroleum_product "Petroleum product").
The company is a subsidiary of the [Nigerian National Petroleum
Corporation](/wiki/Nigerian_National_Petroleum_Corporation "Nigerian National
Petroleum Corporation") (NNPC).[3]

Located at Alesa Eleme, the company operates two oil refineries including an
old plant commissioned in 1965 that can process 60,000 barrels of oil per
stream day and the new plant commissioned in 1989, which has a capacity of
150,000 bpsd. Both oil refineries possess a combined capacity of 210,000
barrels per stream day making PHRC the "biggest oil refining company in
Nigeria".[4][5]
